title: A reminder to all what @Scathlocke canonized
body:
[Because Scathlocke should never be allowed to forget that this happened.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/LUoUJ79w-riot-heres-the-question-do-the-ascended-have-genitals)

Nor should any other Rioters, in case they're wondering about what they should and should not answer.

replies.body:
Shitty start to my birthday because of a fight with friends that got pretty raw, and then I see this post. A much-needed pick me up, that's for sure.

And yeah, after that canonizing you're gonna have to be real clear on what's a joke and what isn't. You dodged a bullet when it came to the origin of Yordles.
Sorry to hear that - Happy Birthday anyway!

A Rioter wishing me happy birthday? Well, that's another nice little boon.

Thank you and much appreciated. Still gonna make sure people remember this, because it's that hilarious.

Does anyone bring it up or give you shit for it inside the company? Any comments from coworkers?
I think there was some general amusement on the day... since then, it's hardly come up.
Now that i'v seen this information i'm inclined to ask...for research purposes, will there ever be a Feminine Ascended or Darkin?

We know quite some female Ascended actually. 
Setaka(died in Where Icathia Once Stood), Shabaka(died in Twilight of the Gods), Naganeka and Valeeva(both survived Twilight of the Gods but we dont know if they were trapped or not).

For further reserch purposes, Setaka animal was unspecified but Shabaka was a raven, Naganeka a snake and Valeeva wasnt specified bu she had spines on her back and an "alabaster skin"

That's a little surprising, since I figure that would have become a "thing" for people to bring up and tease you about.

Well since you're here, maybe I can ask an actual question about the lore and story of the series; anything planned for my favorite fiendish bug Kha'Zix? Aside from his rivalry with Rengar he's never really gone anywhere or actually had **any** involvement in the larger lore.

I know you can't spoil any stories or give much in the way of details, but do you think we'll see anything about League's voidreaver any time in the near future?
Find that keyboard shortcut to rewind time yet?
I am the one responsible for all of this.
I salute you, good sir.

Blessing and curse at the same time. 

{{sticker:sg-lulu}}
How is it a curse?

Mental illness is quite a curse. 

{{sticker:sg-zephyr}}

Well now we have definitive proof that the lore is contradictory. 

I’m willing to believe in space dragons, a mage killing kingdom that worshipped magic sisters, and even immortal mini furries that are supposedly good but don’t seem to actually benefit any society they live in. I can accept all that. 

But if you expect me to believe that a guy like Aatrox has the power to choose his own form, and chose to make himself a Ken doll, well, then you ask too much of me. My suspension of disbelief can only be stretched so far and no further.

> [{quoted}](name=Warlord Dienekes,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=QGrXnpsF,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-06-20T01:42:34.548+0000)
>
> Well now we have definitive proof that the lore is contradictory. 
> 
> I’m willing to believe in space dragons, a mage killing kingdom that worshipped magic sisters, and even immortal mini furries that are supposedly good but don’t seem to actually benefit any society they live in. I can accept all that. 
> 
> But if you expect me to believe that a guy like Aatrox has the power to choose his own form, and chose to make himself a Ken doll, well, then you ask too much of me. My suspension of disbelief can only be stretched so far and no further.

ascending transforms you into what is considered a symbolic form befitting you. the darkin later learned what they could do with this power. however now they are perversions of their original forms and Aatrox tries to get that form back (which he cant because of his memories being warped

The Darkin used to be able to do that. But after they were sealed in their weapons, it's all they can do to make bodies that are "memories" of what they used to look like. And even then, those aren't perfect replicas. Given Aatrox is looking to end the world and all creation so he can finally die, I'm pretty sure he doesn't really bother trying to remember anything about his reproductive organs.

So, what, we're allowed an answer to whether Xayah lays eggs, but not allowed an answer to whether Nasus is hung like a horse?

In all seriousness, though, it seems like a very professional way to address the question. Discussing sex *should* be a natural thing, I don't get why it has to be so taboo. It's not like LoL is targeted at 5 year olds or something, target audience is basically "puberty and above".

I dont want to Necro the old thread so ...

The Greeks viewed large masculinities as "beastly" and sub-human, priding intelligence and other muscles over the one we in the modern US so I wonder if its like that in other ancient cultures too. 
Perhaps it is in Demacia, but I think the culture that reveres animal-headed deities would not find animalesque characteristics below that of human.
OH THIS POST WAS THE BEST, SEEING THE MENTAL OF A RIOTER COLLAPSE WAS AMAZING XD

It was honestly hilarious to read, and I love that this was actually made canon.

All jokes aside though, I'd love for more Rioters to be willing to answer odd and mundane questions like this.
There's still not a moment that goes by that I don't remember why Riot's now a little scared to make a femme-Ascendee. xD
Are they actually? Have they actually said as much?

I mean...wouldn't you be a bit scared of what would happen with that being canon?

I don't think it's something that's a matter of admission or not, more than it is an understood "your move, Riot Design Team!"

I mean they knew what they were getting into with Zoe, and I'm sure they know what people have already done to Yuumi.

What else is there to be afraid of?

. . .I am not able to answer that question without delving deep into a world of BDSM that I'm most certain will violate the ToU of these boards. :P

But I can say, with a female Ascended champion (keep in mind, Ascended see themselves as vastly superior beings, which is why I bring myself to this conclusion I'm making), she would likely run (and mind you, this is *very generic* in my outlook) as some form of dominatrix...and Reddit will tear them asunder. I'd imagine someone similar to Soul Calibur's Ivy, but with a LoL/Shuriman twist, and all the people will more than likely refer immediately to this being canon, particularly with your reminder. xD

I'm pretty sure it's not so much one's clothing that is decided upon Ascending as it is ones build and appearance. Nasus for example is very humanoid, compared to say what Renekton probably looks like. They're both powerfully built and imposing, but Renekton is the one that looks downright beastly.

A female Ascended would, in all likelihood, be the epitome of beauty, grace, and power. An out n' out animalistic Amazon. State of dress would probably vary depending on design and sex appeal, since we don't know how much the Shuriman sun really affects the Ascended.
ahh ok, I guess that's reasonable but still
why the downvotes? it's just good natured humor

Disgusting
Childish
Wrong board
Juvenile
Riding on the popularity of an old post
Calling out/insulting a Rioter

Quite a few possible reasons. But it really is just good-natured humor. ~~Plus none of my friends would ever let me live it down if I said something like this.~~
